Roo Cline) is a VS Code plugin that enhances coding with AI-powered automation, multi-model support, and experimental features","url":"https://github.com/qpd-v/Roo-Code"},{"title":"GitHub - RooCodeInc/Roo-Code: Roo Code gives you a whole dev team of AI agents in your code editor.","url":"https://github.com/RooCodeInc/Roo-Code"},{"title":"Free AI Coding Assistant: Setup Roo Code with Free LLM Models | by Rob Felix | Four Nine Digital | Medium","url":"https://medium.com/four-nine-digital/free-ai-coding-assistant-setup-up-roo-code-with-free-llm-models-04beca21793d"},{"title":"Using VS Code Language Model API With Roo Code | Roo Code Documentation","url":"https://docs.roocode.com/providers/vscode-lm"}]

Based on the search results, here are the key features of the Roo Code VS Code extension in 2026:

## Core Features

Roo Code is described as "A whole dev team of AI agents in your editor", offering comprehensive AI-powered development capabilities.

### Multi-Agent System with Modes

Developers can toggle between Architect, Code, Debug, Ask, and Custom modes, with each mode preserving stateful preferences called "sticky models"—for instance, Architect mode can stay mapped to a high-reasoning model while Code relies on a faster one.

### Model Agnosticism

Roo works with tens of models, from frontier to open weight, and users can choose from a curated selection offered at-cost or bring their own key.

### File and Code Manipulation

Roo Code can directly access and manipulate files within the project workspace, including generating new code, modifying existing files, and displaying diffs to review proposed modifications before accepting them.

### Advanced Capabilities

- Model Context Protocol (MCP) support allows Roo Code to connect with external tools and services like databases or APIs, enabling integration into existing workflows
- Memory Bank for maintaining project understanding over time, plus context mentions (typing @) to include specific files, terminal output, or other relevant information in prompts
- Boomerang Tasks help break down complex coding challenges into smaller, manageable subtasks

### Security and Compliance

The Roo Code Extension is open source, doesn't use user data for training, and is SOC2 Type 2 compliant following industry-standard security practices.

### Cloud Integration

The optional Roo Cloud adds team-oriented capabilities including synced sessions, lightweight task analytics, and "Roomote" collaboration for shared development environments.

## Core Features

Roo Code is described as "A whole dev team of AI agents in your editor", offering comprehensive AI-powered development capabilities.

### Multi-Agent System with Modes

Developers can toggle between Architect, Code, Debug, Ask, and Custom modes, with each mode preserving stateful preferences called "sticky models"—for instance, Architect mode can stay mapped to a high-reasoning model while Code relies on a faster one.

Roo works with tens of models, from frontier to open weight, and users can choose from a curated selection offered at-cost or bring their own key.

content.text:
I couldn't find any AI coding assistant called "komplete-kontrol-cli" (Komplete Kontrol is a Native Instruments music product). Did you mean a different tool, or is this a personal project? Let me compare **Roo Code** vs **Claude Code** instead:

## Quick Comparison

### **Roo Code** (VS Code Extension)
**Strengths:**
- Multi-agent system with specialized modes (Architect, Code, Debug, Ask, Custom)
- Works directly in your IDE with visual diffs and file manipulation
- Model-agnostic (supports dozens of models, switch per mode)
- Memory Bank for persistent project understanding
- MCP support for external tool integration
- Team collaboration features (Roo Cloud, Roomote)
- Open source, SOC2 Type 2 compliant

**Best for:** Developers who live in VS Code and want visual feedback with multi-agent specialization

### **Claude Code** (CLI/Terminal)
**Strengths:**
- Fully autonomous mode (`/auto`) with 21 integrated features
- Advanced memory system with 3-factor retrieval + git-aware organization
- Sophisticated hook system (pre/post execution, validation gates, error handling)
- Multi-model delegation (5+ models: Llama, Qwen, Dolphin, WhiteRabbit, GLM)
- Browser automation (Chrome integration)
- Reverse engineering toolkit (`/re`, Frida scripts)
- Scriptable and composable (shell-first design)
- Context management (auto-checkpoint at 40%, intelligent compaction)
- Constitutional AI safety + validation gates

**Best for:** Terminal-focused developers who want scriptable automation, advanced memory, and system-level control

## Which is Stronger?

**Different strengths for different workflows:**

- **Roo Code wins** if you: prefer visual IDE integration, want mode-based agent switching, need team collaboration
- **Claude Code wins** if you: prefer terminal workflows, need advanced automation/memory, want multi-model fallback, do reverse engineering, need browser automation

**My honest take:** Roo Code is more accessible and IDE-native. Claude Code is more powerful for automation and has deeper system integration, but requires comfort with CLI and hook scripting.

Sources:
- [Roo Code Documentation](https://docs.roocode.com/)
- [Roo Code vs Cline comparison](https://www.qodo.ai/blog/roo-code-vs-cline/)
- [Best AI Coding Assistants 2026](https://www.shakudo.io/blog/best-ai-coding-assistants)
